title: Israeli airstrike on a Gaza school used as a shelter kills at least 80 , Palestinian officials say | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
The Israeli military acknowledged it targeted the Tabeen school in central Gaza City, claiming it hit a Hamas command center within the school.
“There were people praying, there were people washing and there were people upstairs sleeping, including children, women and old people,” he said.
Israel said the targeted school was located next to a mosque serving as a shelter for Gaza City residents.
Late Friday, two separate airstrikes in central Gaza killed at least 13 people including three children and seven women, hospital authorities said.
One strike hit a house in the Nuseirat refugee camp, killing seven people, all but one of them women, hospital officials said.

title: US and coalition personnel sustained minor injuries in Friday drone attack in Syria , official says
message:
CNN —Several United States and coalition personnel were treated for minor injuries after a drone attack in Syria on Friday, a US defense official said, amid heightened tensions in the Middle East.
Personnel were treated for minor injuries, including smoke inhalation, but none were “seriously hurt,” the official said Saturday.
All were stable as of Tuesday, a defense official said.
US officials have long blamed Iran-backed militia groups for attacks on troops in Iraq and Syria.
Between October 17 and January 29, there were more than 150 attacks on US personnel in Iraq and Syria.

title: Long - range missiles key to Israel response to attacks abroad - opinion
message:
Recent advancements have led to the development of Hypersonic Cruise Missiles, which possess high speed and maneuverability, enabling them to evade aerial detection and interception systems effectively.
For instance, researcher Gregory Engel explored this issue in an article titled “The Politics of Naval Innovation: Cruise Missiles and the Tomahawk.” Engel analyzed the origins and development of modern cruise missiles, focusing on the American Tomahawk cruise missile.
Engel notes that air-launched and sea-launched cruise missiles (ALCM/SLCM) began differently but neither would have reached full production and operation without intervention from the highest civilian levels.
The Israel Navy and Israel Aircraft Industry (IAI) have been developing sea-to-sea missiles, including the latest Gabriel 5 type, designed to target naval threats.
The Navy has stated that these advanced missiles ensure their relative advantage and help maintain the IDF’s naval superiority.

title: Palestinians say Israeli strike on Gaza school kills 80
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip — An Israeli airstrike hit a school-turned-shelter in Gaza early Saturday, killing at least 80 people and wounding nearly 50 others, Palestinian health authorities said, in one of the deadliest attacks of the 10-month Israel-Hamas war.
The strike hit without warning before sunrise, according to witness Abu Anas.
Egypt, which borders Gaza, said the strike on the school showed that Israel had no intention of reaching a cease-fire deal.
Late Friday, two separate airstrikes in central Gaza killed at least 13 people, including three children and seven women, hospital authorities said.
One strike hit a house in the Nuseirat refugee camp, killing seven people, all but one of them women, hospital officials said.

title: Israel Names 19 It Claims To Have Killed In Gaza School Strike Amid Global Outcry
message:
The Israeli military on Saturday said that it killed 19 Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad operatives in a strike on a command room within a Gaza school complex, which has drawn widespread condemnation.
The Hamas-run civil defence agency claimed that over 90 people were killed in the attack that sparked outrage among world leaders and rights groups.
Today, the IDF and ISA struck terrorists operating in a Hamas command and control center, which was embedded inside a mosque in the Al-Taba’een school compound.
Hagari explained that Hamas has increasingly used school buildings as military facilities, which has raised significant concerns about civilian safety.
The ongoing conflict, which reignited on October 7 when Hamas launched a surprise attack on Israel, has resulted in significant casualties on both sides.

title: US  deeply concerned  about deadly Israeli strike on Gaza school
message:
Palestinians look at the damage at the site of an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced people, amid the Israel-Hamas conflict, in Gaza City August 10, 2024.
PHOTO:REUTERS/The White House said it was "deeply concerned" about an Israeli airstrike on a Gaza City school compound on Saturday that local civil defence officials say killed around 100 people, adding to condemnation of the attack from several Arab states, Turkey, Britain and the European Union's foreign policy chief.
The school compound in Gaza City housed displaced Palestinian families.
The Gaza Civil Emergency Service, which has a credible record stating casualty numbers, said about 100 people were killed in Saturday's strike.
In the rubble of this school in Gaza City, empty food tins, burnt mattresses, and a child's doll.

title: Israeli strike on Gaza school : US  deeply concerned  about deadly attack
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelWASHINGTON: The White House said it was "deeply concerned" about an Israeli airstrike on a Gaza City school compound on Saturday that local civil defence officials say killed around 100 people, adding to condemnation of the attack from several Arab states, Turkey, Britain and the European Union's foreign policy chief.The school compound in Gaza City housed displaced Palestinian families.
The Gaza Civil Emergency Service, which has a credible record stating casualty numbers, said about 100 people were killed in Saturday's strike.
Israel said around 20 militants had been operating at the compound.Video from the site showed body parts scattered among rubble and more bodies being carried away and covered in blankets.
"Yet again, far too many civilians have been killed," Vice President and Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris told reporters separately on Saturday while also reiterating calls for a Gaza ceasefire.
Saturday's airstrike came a day after a State Department spokesperson said the U.S. will provide Israel $3.5 billion to spend on U.S. weapons and military equipment after Congress appropriated the funds in April.

Egypt, which borders Gaza, said that the strike on the school showed that Israel had no intention of reaching a cease-fire deal.

title: Jordan Will Not Be A Battlefield For Iran Or Israel , Foreign Minister Warns
message:
"We will not be a battlefield for Iran or Israel.
In April, Jordan, which lies between Iran and Israel, said it intercepted flying objects that entered its airspace as Tehran launched explosive drones and fired missiles at Israel in the first direct retaliatory attack of its kind.
Iran has repeatedly vowed to "punish" Israel since the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, the political leader of Iran-backed Palestinian Islamist group Hamas, in Tehran on July 31.
Iran and Hamas blamed Israel for the killing.
Those concerns have also been stoked by the killing of Lebanese armed group Hezbollah's top military commander, Fuad Shukr, in an Israeli strike in Beirut's southern suburbs hours before the assassination of Haniyeh.

title: Hezbollah launches  squadrons of drones , retaliates for Israeli Sidon attack
message:
ALBAWABA - Following the Israeli attack that killed a Hamas commander in Sidon, Lebanon, Hezbollah announced launching "squadrons of explosive-laden drones" at the Michve Alon base near the Galilee town of Safed.
Hezbollah said in a statement that the strikes were "in response to the attack and assassination carried out by the Israeli enemy in the city of Sidon".
On Friday, an Israeli attack on a car in the south Lebanon city of Sidon killed a Hamas leader, according to the Palestinian group and the Israeli military.
The Israeli military said that its aircraft hit the Sidon region and "eliminated" Hajj, whom it characterized as "a senior commander" for Hamas in Lebanon.
Thousands were killed, and dozens of thousands of others were injured in the Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip.

title: Israel broadens its evacuation orders after deadly strike on Gaza school - turned - shelter
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli military ordered more evacuations in southern Gaza early Sunday after a deadly airstrike on a school-turned-shelter in the north killed at least 80 Palestinians, according to local health authorities.
Israel has repeatedly ordered mass evacuations as its troops have returned to heavily destroyed areas where they had previously battled Palestinian militants.
Israel accuses Hamas and other militants of hiding among civilians and launching attacks from residential areas.
The conflict has meanwhile threatened to trigger a regional war, as Israel has traded fire with Iran and its militant allies across the region.
The strike on Saturday hit a mosque inside a school in Gaza City where thousands of people were sheltering.

title: Jordan will not be a battlefield for Iran or Israel , foreign minister warns
message:
CAIRO, (Reuters) – Jordan’s Foreign Minister Ayman Safadi said yesterday that the kingdom would not be a battlefield for Iran or Israel, as the region braces for a possible new wave of attacks by Tehran and its allies following last week’s killing of senior members of militant groups Hamas and Hezbollah.
“We will not be a battlefield for Iran or Israel.
Iran has repeatedly vowed to “punish” Israel since the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, the political leader of Iran-backed Palestinian Islamist group Hamas, in Tehran on July 31.
Iran and Hamas blamed Israel for the killing.
Israel has not claimed or denied responsibility for the killing, which has fuelled concerns that the war between Israel and Hamas in the Gaza Strip could spill into a wider Middle East conflict.

title: US and coalition personnel sustained minor injuries in Friday drone attack in Syria , official says
message:
By Haley Britzky, CNN(CNN) — Several United States and coalition personnel were treated for minor injuries after a drone attack in Syria on Friday, a US defense official said, amid heightened tensions in the Middle East.
Personnel were treated for minor injuries, including smoke inhalation, but none were “seriously hurt,” the official said Saturday.
All were stable as of Tuesday, a defense official said.
US officials have long blamed Iran-backed militia groups for attacks on troops in Iraq and Syria.
Between October 17 and January 29, there were more than 150 attacks on US personnel in Iraq and Syria.

title: UAVs vs Helicopters War Continues With Mi - 8 Hit By Drone And Another Drone Hit By Ka - 52
message:
A new video shows a Ukrainian FPV drone attacking a Russian Mi-8 transport helicopter, apparently hitting its tail assembly.
A second video shows a Russian Ka-52 helicopter shooting down a Ukrainian drone with an anti-tank missile.
💥 Russia: Ukrainian drone operated by the SBU struck a $15 million Russian Mi-8 helicopter in Kursk region.
Russian Mi-8 helicopters have been known to be able to carry EW suites for some time, albeit originally designed to counter MANPADS (Man-Portable Air-Defense Systems) and radar-guided missiles.
For first time in history, a Ka-52 attack helicopter of the #Russian Aerospace Forces shot down a drone using 9K121 Vikhr anti-tank missile.

title: Israel faces anger over Gaza school strike rescuers say killed 93
message:
Rescuers in Gaza said an Israeli air strike on a religious school housing displaced Palestinians killed 93 people on Saturday (10 August), sparking international condemnation despite Israel’s insistence that it was targeting militants.
The White House said it was “deeply concerned” about the Israeli airstrike on the Gaza City school compound, adding Washington was in touch with Israel to seek more information.
Israel has made similar accusations of armed activities after strikes on school shelters, while Hamas has denied using civilian facilities for military aims.
Palestinian militants seized 251 hostages, 111 of whom are still held in Gaza, including 39 the Israeli military says are dead.
Francesca Albanese, the United Nations special rapporteur on the rights situation in Palestinian territories, again accused Israel of “genociding” Palestinians.

title: Hezbollah attacks Israeli base with swarms of suicide drones
message:
Beirut, Aug 11 : Hezbollah has attacked an Israeli base located southwest of Safed city in northern Israel with successive swarms of suicide drones, causing injuries among its members.
"On Saturday, the Islamic Resistance fighters launched an air attack with swarms of suicide drones on the Michve Allon base," Hezbollah said in a statement.
An Israeli drone strike killed the Hamas official, Samer al-Hajj, on Friday at the eastern entrance to the city of Sidon, Xinhua news agency reported.
Meanwhile, the Lebanese military sources, who spoke anonymously, told the news agency that Israeli drones and warplanes carried out 10 airstrikes on six villages and towns during the day in the border area of southern Lebanon, injuring three civilians and destroying 18 homes.
A state of anticipation and caution prevails in Lebanon following Israel's attack on Dahieh in Beirut's southern suburbs, killing Hezbollah senior military commander Fouad Shokor.

title: Around 10 Shahed UAVs shot down over Kyiv , no damage reported in city
message:
Around 10 Shahed UAVs shot down over Kyiv, no damage reported in cityThe aftermath of the Russian attack on Kyiv Oblast.
Source: Kyiv City Military Administration (KCMA)Quote: "The enemy has launched airstrikes on Kyiv for the second time since the beginning of August.
Several dozen Shahed attack UAVs were known to have been launched on Ukraine.
After elaborate manoeuvres, about a dozen of them attempted to attack Kyiv.
However, all the enemy UAVs have been shot down in the airspace of the Ukrainian capital by air defence assets and personnel."

title: Hezbollah Attacks Israeli Base With Swarms Of Suicide Drones
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Beirut, Aug 11 (IANS) Hezbollah has attacked an Israeli base located southwest of Safed city in northern Israel with successive swarms of drones, causing injuries among its members.
"On Saturday, the Islamic Resistance fighters launched an air attack with swarms of suicide drones on the Michve Allon base," Hezbollah said in a statement.
An Israeli drone strike killed the Hamas official, Samer al-Hajj, on Friday at the eastern entrance to the city of Sidon, Xinhua news agency reported.
Meanwhile, the Lebanese military sources, who spoke anonymously, told the news agency that Israeli drones and warplanes carried out 10 airstrikes on six villages and towns during the day in the border area of southern Lebanon, injuring three civilians and destroying 18 homes.
A state of anticipation and caution prevails in Lebanon following Israel's attack on Dahieh in Beirut's southern suburbs, killing Hezbollah senior military commander Fouad Shokor.

title: Hezbollah Attacked Israeli Base With Swarms Of Suicide Drones
message:
(MENAFN- Nam News Network) BEIRUT, Aug 11 (NNN-NNA) – Hezbollah, yesterday, attacked a Zionist base, located south-west of Safed city, in northern Israel, with successive swarms of drones, causing injuries among its members.
“Yesterday, the Islamic Resistance fighters launched an air attack with swarms of suicide drones, on the Michve Allon base,” Hezbollah said in a statement.
An Israeli drone strike killed the Hamas official, Samer al-Hajj, on Friday, at the eastern entrance to the city of Sidon, deep in southern Lebanon.
A state of anticipation and caution prevails in Lebanon, following Israel's attack on Dahieh, in Beirut's southern suburbs, killing Hezbollah senior military commander, Fouad Shokor.
Hezbollah Secretary-General, Hassan Nasrallah, threatened retaliation.– NNN-NNA

title: Hezbollah attacks Israeli base with swarms of suicide drones
message:
You are here:视频播放位置 下载安装Flash播放器BEIRUT, Aug. 10 (Xinhua) -- Hezbollah attacked on Saturday an Israeli base located southwest of Safed city in northern Israel with successive swarms of suicide drones, causing injuries among its members.
"On Saturday, the Islamic Resistance fighters launched an air attack with swarms of suicide drones on the Michve Allon base," Hezbollah said in a statement.
An Israeli drone strike killed the Hamas official, Samer al-Hajj, on Friday at the eastern entrance to the city of Sidon, deep in southern Lebanon.
Meanwhile, the Lebanese military sources, who spoke anonymously, told Xinhua that Israeli drones and warplanes carried out ten airstrikes on six villages and towns during the day in the border area of southern Lebanon, injuring three civilians and destroying 18 homes.
A state of anticipation and caution prevails in Lebanon following Israel's attack on Dahieh in Beirut's southern suburbs, killing Hezbollah senior military commander Fouad Shokor.

title: Kamala Harris says  too many  civilian deaths in Gaza
message:
Kamala Harris says 'too many' civilian deaths in GazaUS Vice-President Kamala Harris has condemned the loss of civilian life in an Israeli air strike against a school building in Gaza on Saturday.
An Israeli military spokesman said al-Taba’een school "served as an active Hamas and Islamic Jihad military facility", which Hamas denies.
The building also served as a mosque and the Israeli strike hit during dawn prayers, witnesses said.
[Reuters]Hamas-led gunmen killed about 1,200 people in an attack on Israel on 7 October, taking 251 others back to Gaza as hostages.
That attack triggered a massive Israeli military offensive against Gaza and the current war.

title: International Outcry Follows Israeli Airstrike on Gaza School , Leaving Nearly 100 Dead ! - Novinite . com
message:
At least 93 people were killed in an Israeli airstrike on a school and mosque in Gaza that was sheltering displaced Palestinians, according to local officials cited by CNN.
The Gaza Civil Defense reported that the strike occurred during dawn prayers at the Al-Tabi'in compound in Gaza City's Al-Daraj neighborhood.
According to the IDF, an Israeli airstrike targeted a Hamas command center inside a mosque located in a Gaza City school compound, killing 19 terrorists.
International condemnation of the Israeli strike has been widespread, with several countries, including Arab states, Turkey, France, and the European Union, denouncing the attack.
Israel, however, maintained that the strike targeted militants and that the reported death toll was exaggerated.

title: Australia joins other nations to condemn deadly Israeli air strike on Gaza school
message:
Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong has condemned the deaths of dozens of civilians in an Israeli air strike in a school compound housing displaced Palestinians in Gaza City.
Palestinians mourn their dead following an Israeli strike on the Al-Taba'een school in the Daraj Tuffah neighborhood of Gaza, 10 August 2024.
Video from the site showed body parts scattered among rubble and more bodies being carried away and covered by blankets.
Israel says death toll inflatedIsrael said the toll was inflated and 19 militants were among the dead.
It added that no severe damage was caused to the compound, and provided aerial photos and videos which it said proved this.

title: Israel - Hamas War Day 310 | IDF Orders Some Residents of Gaza Khan Yunis to Evacuate Ahead of Operation - Israel News
message:
Open gallery view A displaced Palestinian girl sits under a mattress as waits to flee Hamad City with her family following an Israeli evacuation order in Khan Yunis in southern Gaza Strip, on Sunday.
Credit: Hatem Khaled/ReutersPhilippe Lazzarini, head of the United Nations' agency for Palestinian refugees UNRWA, said people in Gaza were trapped and have nowhere to go.
"Some are only able to carry their children with them, some carry their whole lives in one small bag.
On Sunday morning, the IDF called on residents of the Al-Jala neighborhood in northern Khan Yunis, which is inside the humanitarian zone, to evacuate the area.
The army announced that it is preparing to operate within the neighborhood due to intelligence information regarding terrorist activities.

title: Ukraine foray into Russia border region embarrasses Putin . How will it affect the course of war ? - Boston News , Weather , Sports
message:
The surprise foray has prompted thousands of civilians to flee the region as the Russian military struggles to repel the attack.
The Ukrainian forces have widely used drones to strike Russian military vehicles and deployed electronic warfare assets to suppress Russian drones and derail military communications.
The Russian units along the frontier consisted mostly of poorly trained conscript soldiers, who were easily overcome by elite Ukrainian units.
At least one Russian helicopter was downed and another one was damaged by the advancing Ukrainian forces, according to Russian military bloggers.
Russia has declared a federal emergency in the Kursk region, giving local authorities more powers to quickly coordinate an emergency response.

title: The unsung saga of Rani Avanti Bai - The Statesman
message:
Don’t forget this.” In 2011, the HRD ministry made a suggestion to the NCERT to consider the inclusion of Rani Avantibai in school textbooks.
When the British appointed an administrator for Ramgarh, Avantibai took charge of the administration throwing out the administrator.
Rather than succumbing to grief and despair, Rani Avantibai channeled her sorrow into a fierce determination to continue the fight against the British.
Unwilling to fall prey to the British onslaught, Rani Avanti moved to the hills of Devharigarh for safety.
Now called the Rani Avanti Bai Lodhi Sagar, it is a multi-purpose irrigation and hydro-electric project across the Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Walz hits back at Team Trump : He  knows nothing about service
message:
Tim Walz (D-Minn.) criticized former President Trump, saying he knows “nothing about service,” as the campaign trail debate over Walz’s military record continues.
“Each of you talk about service, Donald Trump knows nothing about service,” he said.
Trump, in a post on TruthSocial earlier this week, slammed Walz as a “disgrace” when commenting on an opinion piece that criticized Walz over his military career.
The former president’s new running mate, Sen. JD Vance (R-Ohio), has criticized Walz for leaving the military before his unit was deployed.
On the campaign trail this week, Walz has criticized both Trump and Vance.

title: Walz  misspoke  in reference to  weapons of war , that I carried in war , campaign says
message:
Tim Walz, the Democratic candidate for vice president, "misspoke" in a 2018 video about "weapons of war that I carried in war," a Harris-Walz campaign spokesperson said Saturday.
The comment suggests that Walz portrayed himself as someone who spent time in a combat zone.
Walz served 24 years in various Army National Guard units but he was never in a combat zone.
Lauren Hitt, a spokesperson for the Harris-Walz campaign, said Saturday in a statement that Walz misspoke in the 2018 video.
"In making the case for why weapons of war should never be on our streets or in our classrooms, the Governor misspoke," Hitt added.

Lauren Hitt, a spokesperson for the Harris-Walz campaign, said Saturday in a statement that Walz misspoke in the 2018 video.
"In making the case for why weapons of war should never be on our streets or in our classrooms, the Governor misspoke," Hitt added.

title: Kremlin downplays scale of events in Kursk Oblast – ISW
message:
The Kremlin has likely opted to declare a counterterrorism operation (CTO) regime instead of martial law to downplay the scale of the incursion into Kursk Oblast and to avoid causing panic or backlash domestically.
Map depicting areas in Russia's Kursk Oblast under Ukrainian control.
Geolocated footage and Russian reporting from 10 August indicates that Ukrainian forces largely maintain previously reported positions in Kursk Oblast and have advanced slightly further than their previously confirmed positions.
Ukraine’s cross-border operation into Kursk Oblast threatens the Kremlin with a potential political crisis regarding casualties among Russian conscripts, whom the Kremlin has increasingly relied upon to defend the Russian state border with Ukraine.
Russian forces recently advanced near Kreminna, Toretsk, Pokrovsk, and Donetsk City.

message:
As we reported, CNN’s “noxious” anchor Brianna Keilar took a swipe at GOP vice presidential nominee JD Vance’s military career, implying that he had somehow embellished his record.
Her discomfort is palpable as she says, “Attacks on JD Vance's service are also offensive”:Brianna Keilar @brikeilarcnn: “The Trump campaign is swift boating Tim Walz.
Attacks on JD Vance’s service are also offensive.
"In a country where so few shoulder the burden, military service should not be a liability, it should be an asset," she continued.
In fact, she said, not having experienced combat "doesn't make them or their service less admirable, or less necessary.

title: North Korea flies more trash - filled balloons towards South , says Seoul
message:
South Korea’s military says North Korea is again flying balloons likely carrying trash toward the South, adding to a bizarre psychological warfare campaign amid growing tensions between the war-divided rivals.
South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said Saturday that the winds could carry the balloons to regions north of the South Korean capital, Seoul.
North Korea last flew balloons toward the South on July 24, when trash carried by at least one of them fell on the South Korean presidential compound, raising worries about the vulnerability of key South Korean facilities.
The balloon contained no dangerous material and no one was hurt, South Korea’s presidential security service said.
Experts say North Korea hates such broadcasts because it fears it could demoralize front-line troops and residents.

title: IDF increases GPS disruptions amid tensions Iranian , Hezbollah threats
message:
Even at the end of Netanyahu's visit to the United States about two weeks ago, due to GPS disruptions, flightradar24—the website that shows passenger plane flight data on a map in real-time—showed that the "Zion Wing" plane, which Prime Minister Netanyahu used, had landed in Beirut.
Since October 7, the IDF has operated proactive disruptions mainly in the northern and southern regions of the country.
The purpose of the disruptions is apparently to interfere with the activity of hostile aircraft and drones that use GPS systems for navigation.
The unit already reported on Saturday night about 130% recruitment of reserves, among them an 80-year-old veteran.
The importance of the electronic warfare headquarters unit is the flexibility to move from place to place quickly and use its capabilities in the field.

title: Zelensky Acknowledges Operations Inside Russia for the First Time
message:
Every direction, every point of combat engagement,” he then mentioned the regions of fighting everywhere except inside Russia.
“Well done, guys!” Zelensky said, congratulating troops fighting within Ukraine over the week.
He listed various AFU units engaged in combat operations on Ukrainian soil, both in occupied and non-occupied.
I have just held a preparatory meeting on a decision that will strengthen our Ukrainian spiritual independence.
And the decisions to achieve this must be one hundred percent effective – they must really work.

title: Harris campaign says Walz  misspoke  in 2018 reference to carrying weapons in war
message:
Tim Walz, Vice President Kamala Harris' running mate, "misspoke" in a video from 2018 where Walz said he handled weapons "in war," a Harris-Walz campaign spokesperson told the Associated Press (AP) Saturday.
The 2018 video was circulated on social media by the Harris campaign, according to AP.
In the video, Walz speaks out against gun violence saying, "We can make sure that those weapons of war, that I carried in war, is the only place where those weapons are at."
What the Harris-Walz campaign is sayingA spokesperson for the Harris-Walz campaign, Lauren Hitt, told AP in a statement Saturday that Walz had "misspoke" in the video.
"In making the case for why weapons of war should never be on our streets or in our classrooms, the Governor misspoke," Hitt continued.

title: Ukraine Bold Incursion into Russia : Intense Battles Continue in Kursk Region
message:
President Volodymyr Zelenskiy acknowledged on Saturday that Ukrainian forces are engaged in combat in Russia's Kursk region, marking Kyiv's largest incursion into Russian territory since the war began.
In his nightly address, Zelenskiy vowed to restore justice amid Russia's aggression, which began in February 2022.
Russian President Vladimir Putin has described the Ukrainian offensive as a major provocation.
On Sunday, debris from a destroyed Ukraine-launched missile injured 13 people in a residential area in Kursk, leading officials to expedite civilian evacuations.
Although both Kyiv and Moscow deny targeting civilians, the ongoing war has resulted in thousands of deaths and significant displacement.

title: Seoul says North Korea has flown more trash balloons toward South Korea | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
By KIM TONG-HYUNG Associated PressSEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s military says North Korea is again flying balloons likely carrying trash toward the South, adding to a bizarre psychological warfare campaign amid growing tensions between the war-divided rivals.
South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said Saturday that the winds could carry the balloons to regions north of the South Korean capital, Seoul.
North Korea last flew balloons toward the South on July 24, when trash carried by at least one of them fell on the South Korean presidential compound, raising worries about the vulnerability of key South Korean facilities.
The balloon contained no dangerous material and no one was hurt, South Korea’s presidential security service said.
Experts say North Korea hates such broadcasts because it fears it could demoralize front-line troops and residents.

title: Russian Army Loses 1 , 220 Soldiers In Ukraine Over Past 24 Hours
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Russia lost about 590,920 in Ukraine between February 24, 2022 and August 11, 2024, including 1,220 killed or wounded in action in the past 24 hours.
The General Staff of the of Ukraine said this in a post on , Ukrinform reports.
In addition, Ukraine's defense forces destroyed 8,447 (+6) Russian tanks, 16,363 (+13) armored fighting vehicles, 16,663 (+58) artillery systems, 1,143 multiple rocket launchers, 918 anti-aircraft warfare systems, and 2,425 missiles.
The Russian also lost 366 warplanes, 328 (+1) helicopters, 13,399 (+27) tactical unmanned aerial systems, 28 warships/cutters, 1 submarine, 22,524 (+71) vehicles and fuel tankers, and 2,800 (+11) pieces of special equipment.

title: Walz  misspoke  in saying he served  in war , Harris campaign says
message:
Tim Walz “misspoke” in a newly resurfaced video from 2018 in which he said he handled assault weapons “in war,” a Harris campaign spokesperson told CNN on Saturday.
“We can make sure those weapons of war, that I carried in war, are only carried in war,” Walz said in the video.
Lauren Hitt, a Harris campaign spokesperson, said in a statement the governor misspoke in the clip.
The clarification from the Harris campaign comes as the Trump campaign has sought to discredit Walz’s military service in the days since he joined the Democratic ticket.
“What bothers me about Tim Walz is the stolen valor garbage,” Vance said.

title: Zelenskyy advance : Battle of Kursk may have profound significance
message:
According to The Institute for the Study of War (ISW), a Washington-based think tank, Ukrainian forces managed to push up to 20 miles deep into the region.
Analysts of the Ukrainian operation, however, say it remains unclear what control of that station could bring Ukraine.
There Russian forces have pressed offensives in several sectors and made slow but steady gains, relying on their edge in firepower.
Russia has already moved extra tanks, artillery and rocket systems to its southern Kursk region to battle the shock incursion.
One must certainly be wary of making overt comparisons, but this second battle of Kursk could also yet prove to have profound significance for the current conflict between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Despicable : Jesse Ventura Criticizes JD Vance For Accusing Tim Walz Of  Stolen Valor
message:

Vance for his comments on Democratic Minnesota Gov.
During an appearance on CNN’s “Laura Coates Live,” he referred to Vance’s claim of stolen valor against Walz as “despicable” and accused him of disrespecting a fellow veteran.
So what George Bush did was sign an executive order sending the National Guard into foreign deployment,” Ventura added.
Walz’s military service centers on his decision to retire from the Minnesota National Guard in 2005, just before his battalion was set to deploy to Iraq.

title: Kyiv daring move needs Western support
message:
It serves as an important reminder that President Zelensky’s forces have much left in the tank.
Given this marks the first time regular Ukrainian forces have been used in this way, it is widely suspected they are doing so with some sort of approval from the Western alliance.
But the move has turned the tables of this war on Putin, and will act as a significant boost to Kyiv’s morale.
Earlier this week President Zelensky promised a “just peace through just force”.

title: Record US$20 billion Taiwan defence budget to  mostly cover existing expenses
message:
The unprecedented defence spending, out of a total expenditure of NT$3.13 trillion, is almost double the NT$359 billion listed during the first year of Lai’s predecessor Tsai Ing-wen’s term in 2016.
“Our goal is to build a formidable military force capable of ensuring our survival and development, as well as safeguarding the lives and property of our people,” he said.
However, Washington opposes any unilateral change to the status quo and is committed to supplying weapons for the island’s defence.
The mainland’s defence budget for 2024 stands at 1.67 trillion yuan (US$232 billion), up 7.2 per cent from last year and at least 16.5 times larger than Taiwan’s.
“After all, sharply increasing our defence spending will crowd out other budget allocations,” he said.

title: Italian Navy carrier strike group arrives on Guam
message:
The Italian Navy Carrier Strike Group Cavour arrived on Guam Sunday morning after participating in multi-nation military exercises in Darwin, Australia, before heading to Japan.
The Italian carrier strike group, consisting of the aircraft carrier Cavour and the frigate Alpino, participated in the "Pitch Black 2024" air exercise.
The activity is part of the strategic objectives of the Italian Carrier Strike Group's campaign for increasing interoperability and cooperation with the navies of allied and partner countries.
The Italian carrier strike group is commanded by Rear Admiral Giancarlo Ciappina, while Cavour's commander is Captain Milos Argenton and the frigate Alpino is commanded by Salvatore Santangelo.
The Italian carrier strike group's visit comes days after Nimitz-class aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln also arrived at U.S.

title: Russia pushes back at Ukraine cross - border assault , but Kyiv presses on
message:
KYIV — Russia is pushing back against Ukraine’s largest assault into Russian territory since the start of the war, sending troop reinforcements, establishing strict security measures in border areas and conducting airstrikes, according to the Russian Defense Ministry.
One of the strikes on Ukrainian troops involved a thermobaric missile that causes a blast wave and suffocates those in its path, the ministry said.
Belarus’ defense minister said on Telegram that the country’s air defense forces had destroyed several Ukrainian drones that violated Belarusian airspace Friday.
It would also relieve pressure on Ukrainian troops who are outnumbered and have been losing ground in eastern and southern Ukraine.
So far, Russian forces have not let up in their front-line pushes.

title: JD Vance isnt the first . These 4 presidential elections also had Cincinnati candidates
message:
Vance is, however, the first candidate from Greater Cincinnati on the ballot since James M. Cox ran for president in 1920.
Here are four memorable elections that featured candidates from Greater Cincinnati.
A campaign poster for Democratic candidates George B. McClellan and George Hunt Pendleton for the 1864 presidential election.
William Howard Taft spent election day in CincinnatiWilliam Howard Taft was the only president born in Cincinnati, rather than in the region.
This article originally appeared on Cincinnati Enquirer: How other Cincinnati candidates fared in past presidential elections

title: Netflix  Robot Apocalypse Movie  Uses Real Mariupol Battle Footage
message:
However, it's a real video clip filmed by Azov during the Mariupol battles,” he wrote.
“@netflix Is it okay for you to use real footage of a tragic event in Ukraine, during war and genocide?
I can't believe you have permission to include real video in a feature film.”“Thank you, now I definitely won’t watch it.
To compare so many deaths and family tragedies to entertainment content, especially in a context unrelated to the war in Ukraine,” writes another user, Natali.
Currently, neither Netflix nor Ukrainian officials have commented on the incident but UNITED24 Media also commented on the broadcast.

message: The Toyota Yaris Cross stacks up as the more fuel efficient of the two vehicles on paper, with a claimed fuel economy figure of 3.8L/100km as opposed to the Venue which uses 7.0L/100km.

On this day, notable figures in Indian history mark their birth anniversary, including Sadashiv Kanoji Patil, Lalmani Mishra, Madireddy Venkat Narasimha Rao and Sunil Shetty.
Madireddy Venkat Narasimha Rao, a former Indian cricketer, was born in 1954 and is renowned for his contributions in promoting the sport.
The first Olympic Games after the Second World War took place in 1948 in London after the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

title: Special Operations : Russia Switches to Assassination and Sabotage
message:
August 11, 2024: Russia views the combat zone as much larger than the areas in Ukraine where fighting is currently underway.
Russia has admitted that they consider NATO nations supporting Ukraine to be full of legitimate targets.
Russia does not issue press releases about its sabotage and assassination campaign in NATO countries supporting the Ukrainians.
Americans and European intelligence nations detected these plans and did so early enough to disrupt Russian efforts to implement their plans.
This information was shared with other NATO nations and Ukraine, which will become a NATO member when the war is over.

title: I protested Vietnam War at DNC 1968 . This year , Ill rally for our nation future .
message:
The last time I was at a political rally was in 1968 in downtown Chicago to protest the Vietnam War.
My long flowing hair, held in place by a blue and white bandanna, touched the middle of my back.
I wore a string of green and yellow beads around my neck and a short red and white summer dress.
Another deep political divideIn 2024, I find myself, once again, tired of the political division and discourse that is being played.
I’m primed, eager and stoked to march once again in Chicago during the 2024 Democratic National Convention.

title: Fraudie Murphy : Tim Walz Owes America An Explanation And An Apology
message:
I have to be honest; I’d never heard of a “CommandSergeantMajor” before Kamala Harris chose Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her running mate.
Since 2005 and deciding to run for Congress, every single time Tim Walz has spoken or written about his military career he has lied about.
AdvertisementThere doesn’t seem to be any consequence for Democrats who lie about their military service, explicitly or implicitly.
At some point, and let it be with Tim Walz, a line must be drawn or responsibility exacted, doesn’t it?
Fraudie Murphy should be commended for his service, but condemned for exaggerating and lying about it, and ultimately stealing the valor of those who actually did what Tim Walz only pretended to have done.

title: Tens of thousands evacuated from Russia Kursk region - World
message:
MOSCOW: Struggling to put down a major Ukrainian incursion for a fifth day, Russia on Saturday said it had evacuated tens of thousands of people from its border region, launched a “counter-terror operation” and warned that the fighting was endangering a nuclear power plant.
Ukrainian units stormed into Russia’s western Kursk region on Tuesday morning in a shock attack, the largest and most successful cross-border offensive by Kyiv of the two-and-a-half-year conflict.
Kyiv has maintained a strict operational silence on the offensive and is yet publicly to confirm it is even behind the attack.
Russia’s nuclear agency on Saturday warned of a “direct threat” to the nearby Kursk nuclear power station, and local officials detailed the scale of civilian evacuations from towns and villages close to the combat zone.
Russia’s army on Saturday confirmed it was still fighting the Ukrainian incursion for a fifth day.

Walz served 24 years in various Army National Guard units but he was never in a combat zone.
Lauren Hitt, a spokesperson for the Harris-Walz campaign, said Saturday in a statement that Walz misspoke in the 2018 video.
"In making the case for why weapons of war should never be on our streets or in our classrooms, the Governor misspoke," Hitt added.

title: Walz  misspoke  in 2018 reference to  weapons of war , that I carried in war , Harris campaign says | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
Tim Walz, the Democratic candidate for vice president, “misspoke” in a 2018 video about “weapons of war that I carried in war,” a Harris-Walz campaign spokesperson said Saturday.
Republicans, including the vice presidential nominee, Ohio Sen. JD Vance, began questioning Walz’s military record after Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic candidate for president, named the governor as her running mate on Tuesday.
Walz served 24 years in various Army National Guard units but he was never in a combat zone.
Lauren Hitt, a spokesperson for the Harris-Walz campaign, said Saturday in a statement that Walz misspoke in the 2018 video.
“In making the case for why weapons of war should never be on our streets or in our classrooms, the Governor misspoke,” Hitt added.

title: Former Israeli hostage medical conditions upon leaving Gaza revealed
message:
The brutal attack led to the death of over 1,250 Israelis and the hostage-taking of 250 men, women, children, babies, and elderly people.
Significant attention was paid to anticipating potential medical problems, taking into account the patient's medical history while maintaining medical confidentiality.
All patients underwent a medical evaluation that included a medical admission questionnaire, a basic physical examination, blood tests, fecal tests, and urine tests.
All reported psychological terrorism, with various psychological warfare strategies, including isolation, intimidation, food and water restriction, and psychological abuse.
Some of the hostages suffered immediate anxiety disorders and began psychiatric medication.

title: Thousands Evacuated In Russia Amid Ongoing Ukrainian Offensive
message:
Moscow also raised concerns that the ongoing conflict in Russia’s western Kursk region might pose a risk to a nearby nuclear power plant.
Ukrainian forces launched a major offensive early Tuesday, marking the largest and most successful such operation by Kyiv in the two-and-a-half-year conflict.
Ukrainian troops have made several kilometers of advancement, prompting Russia to deploy additional reserves and equipment.
Russia’s military confirmed on Saturday that the fighting with Ukrainian forces had continued for a fifth day.
In response, Russia launched a missile strike on a supermarket in Kostyantynivka, eastern Ukraine, on Friday, killing at least 14 people.
